rdf:about="http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif">     <title>Powered by L-Soft's LISTSERV mailing list manager</title>     <link>http://www.lsoft.com/products/listserv-powered.asp</link>     <url>http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif</url> </image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;bd16d427.1503">   <title>Re: Blocked Care </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;bd16d427.1503</link>   <description> Hi<br><br>There is a very readable chapter in &quot;Brain-Based Parenting:&quot; D Hughes and J Baylin - pages 81-101<br><br>Best wishes<br><br>Debbie<br>Dr Deborah Curson<br>Clinical Psychologist<br>Conatus<br>01926 678085    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T18:24:51+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Debbie Plant</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;bd16d427.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;ad410045.1503">   <title>Blocked Care </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;ad410045.1503</link>   <description> Dear all<br><br>I hope you are well. I'm just wondering if anyone has to hand a digestible article around Blocked Care? I am just at the very start of a piece of work with an adoptive disruption situation and I am pretty sure the parents are very disengaged and hurt both from their child as well as from the processes that have become instigated following the breakdown. I think an article might help strike up a 'pre-conversation conversation'... [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T11:34:26+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alastair Barnett</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;ad410045.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;ca0fa05e.1502">   <title>Re: Discussion group for Conatus child psychologists </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;ca0fa05e.1502</link>   <description> HI Jacky and Suzanne<br><br>I've just started some consultations with a fostering agency in Bromsgrove. I have a number of dates across the year and can check with them if they would be happy for Suzanne to shadow.<br><br>I do the work on Mondays and can pass dates on once I have had the conversation with the agency. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-24T21:54:40+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Debbie Plant</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;ca0fa05e.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;76f6b6cc.1502">   <title>Re: AS Mum? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;76f6b6cc.1502</link>   <description> I'm not aware of anything specific, but I wondered if West Midlands Autism may have information? I'll ask the primary mental health workers at work, as they often have access to resources such as these<br><br>Best wishes<br><br>Debbie<br>Dr Deborah Curson<br>Clinical Psychologist<br>Conatus<br>01926 678085    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-24T21:52:06+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Debbie Plant</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;76f6b6cc.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;a549e78b.1502">   <title>Re: AS Mum? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;a549e78b.1502</link>   <description> A number of the local parents supports groups will be used to parents themselves having diagnosed or undiagnosed AS. My experience is that other parents are usually very supportive &amp; often appropriately challenging to others who are struggling with their own needs; so that might be one way forward? Otherwise there are some books written by parents who have AS themselves- one memorable name is Leanne Holiday-Willey (I think!)- Jessica Kingsley Pubs<br>Jacky<br>x [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T15:12:59+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jacqueline Knibbs</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;a549e78b.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;2273812c.1502">   <title>AS Mum? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;2273812c.1502</link>   <description> Dear All<br><br>Here's some casework discussion - I'm breaking the ice on our discussion group ...<br><br>Does anyone have any suggestions or resources for 'Asperger parenting'?<br><br>I'm working with a family with a child who has a number of developmental diffs, poss ASD, and her Mum has been diagnosed with Asperger Syndrome.<br><br>I am looking to work towards her developing a better understanding/appreciation of her child's needs, complex LD as well as needs from Mum as a parent. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T13:57:29+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alastair Barnett</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;2273812c.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;292f2b50.1502">   <title>Re: Discussion group for Conatus child psychologists </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;292f2b50.1502</link>   <description> Hello again,<br><br>I wonder if I might introduce Suzanne Chojnacki to you as a potential honorary assistant psychologist. Suzanne is currently on our Masters course in Clin.Applications of Psychology at Warwick Uni . Suzanne has a placement with the children`s autism team in Coventry but unfortunately the team is undergoing some changes and so she is under-utilised there. So if anyone has any pieces of clinical work that Suzanne might join you for & help out with, she would very much appreciate the experience. Suzanne`s time is fairly flexible at the moment; I have copied Suzanne into this email so [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-15T10:04:07+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jacqueline Knibbs</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;292f2b50.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;d4c98b16.1501">   <title>Re: Discussion group for Conatus child psychologists </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;d4c98b16.1501</link>   <description> Hello All,<br>Apologies Alastair,<br>I realise this doesn't constitute casework, but thought I'd take the<br>opportunity to advertise links with the Clin. psych course. I'm recruiting<br>for help with Selection this year (good CPD?). Also we're always on the<br>look-out for placement or research opportunities. A jointly supervised<br>private/NHS child placement would be interesting if you could e.g team up<br>with a chum in CAMHS. All Ideas welcomed! Please get in touch if there's<br>anything you'd like to see the training course offering<br>Much appreciated<br>Thanx [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-29T07:45:14+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jacqueline Knibbs</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;d4c98b16.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;f537e73b.1501">   <title>Discussion group for Conatus child psychologists </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;f537e73b.1501</link>   <description> Dear All<br><br>Finally I've managed to get some sort of the show on the road!<br><br>Sorry about the delay, having asked you all before Christmas about this group. All being well, once I've clicked 'Send' to this e-mail then it will be sent to all of your e-mail addresses. It would be helpful if one or two of you could just let me know you have received the e-mail. I think you can click reply to me only, or you can click reply to everyone and then the e-mail is basically circulated to everyone in the list. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-28T18:43:44+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alastair Barnett</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONATUS-CASEWORK-DISCUSSION;f537e73b.1501</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
